meanings.definition: Moving in a circle or spiral
meanings.sent1: The merry-go-round at the park is a gyratory ride.
meanings.sent2: The swirling tornado had a gyratory motion as it moved across the plains.
meanings.sent3: The gyratory dance move made everyone at the party laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were like a gyratory whirlpool, constantly circling in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The gyratory pattern of the seashells on the beach was mesmerizing.

meanings.definition: A machine or device with a rotating motion
meanings.sent1: The factory installed a new gyratory to improve production.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the gyratory to understand its mechanism.
meanings.sent3: The gyratory in the playground was so popular that all the kids wanted to play on it.
meanings.sent4: The gears in the clockwork moved like a gyratory, ticking away the seconds.
meanings.sent5: The old windmill had a large gyratory that powered the entire farm.

meanings.definition: Characterized by or involving rotation or turning
meanings.sent1: The gyratory movement of the planets around the sun is fascinating.
meanings.sent2: The gymnast's routine included many gyratory flips and spins.
meanings.sent3: The chef's gyratory cooking style made the dish taste even better.
meanings.sent4: The storm's gyratory winds caused trees to sway back and forth.
meanings.sent5: The dancer's gyratory performance left the audience in awe.
